title: Child visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Child Visa (Subclass 101), a permanent visa allowing eligible children outside Australia to live with their Australian parent. It outlines eligibility requirements, costs, processing times, obligations, and conditions for adopted children, stepchildren, and dependent children.

structured_data.description: This visa lets a child outside Australia move to Australia to live with their parents.

details: Unlimited travel to and from Australia while travel facility is valid
After 5 years, child must apply for and be granted an RRV to re-enter as a permanent resident
Child may consider Australian citizenship to avoid needing a visa for re-entry

what_child_can_do: Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English language classes via the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)

dependency_requirements.dependency_exclusion: A child does not meet dependency requirement if the stepparent is the current spouse/de facto of the child's biological or adopted parent.

requirements: Must have been adopted before turning 18
Adopted by a parent who was NOT an Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen at the time of adoption
adopted_children.alternative_visa: Adoption visa (subclass 102) may apply if the adoptive parent was already an Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen at the time of adoption

requirements: Must be child of the step-parentâ€™s former partner
step_parent_must_have: An Australian parenting order stating the child is to live with and be cared for by them, OR
Guardianship or custody under Australian or foreign law

age_requirements: Over 18 and under 25 years old and studying full time, OR
Over 18 years old with a disability
eligibility.relationship_status_requirement: Child must be single and dependent on the parent
eligibility.location_requirement: Child must be outside Australia when the application is lodged
eligibility.covid_concessions: Child may be eligible for COVID-19 visa concessions

requirements: Child must be sponsored by an eligible parent or their parent's spouse or de facto partner
Sponsorship must be approved before visa grant
restrictions: If sponsor or their partner has a pending registrable offence charge, sponsorship and visa will be refused
If sponsor or their partner has a registrable offence conviction, sponsorship can only be approved in limited circumstances

child_may_apply_if: One parent was an Australian citizen at the child's birth

including_other_children.siblings: Separate applications required for each sibling
including_other_children.dependent_children: Can be included at time of application or any time before decision
health_requirements: Dependent children must meet health requirement
Non-migrating family members may also need to meet health requirement

costs.pricing_tool: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include additional costs)

structured_data.apply_from: Child must be outside Australia when the application is submitted

processing_times.guide: Use visa processing time guide tool
processing_times.notes: Times shown are not specific to individual applications
may_take_longer_if: Missing documents or need for more information
Incorrect or unpaid visa application charge
processing_times.communication_process: Department contacts applicant if more information is needed or when outcome is ready

obligations.entry_requirement: Child must enter Australia before the date in the grant letter (generally 12 months from grant date)

structured_data.visa_label: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label
